titleStmt.title: J. T. Metcalfe to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG2040

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p:
Cincinnati Ohio
Feby 11th. 1865
Hon -- Thos E. Bramlette
Dear sir:

of this city desires the appointment of Commissioner of Deeds for Ohio in . He is the son of Esq, a lawyer of this city, and is a young gentleman of good habits attentive to business, and would make a good commissioner. I deem it proper to state that he is about nineteen years of age; but I suppose the statute does not fix the age at which a person is competent.Howard DouglassKentuckyJohn G. Douglass
I am satisfied that Mr. Douglass would make a capabale commissioner, and would be gratified at his appointment.
